Description.val: Handles the Range, Locate, Sort and Print Data internal events

Comment.val: This component provides an interface for the user to perform Range, Locate, Sort and Print Data.The component does not expose any object. It has logic units for handling the Range, Locate, Sort and Print Data internal events.The source code for this component is available in the Add_On\UserFunctionality directory, so you can customize the screens of the component as you wish.

Text.val: Set the language using SetLang(). If Default is chosen, then SetLang()

Text.valUnicode: {\rtf1\fbidis\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset0 Microsoft Sans Serif;}} {\colortbl ;\red0\green0\blue0;\red255\green0\blue128;} {\*\generator Msftedit 5.41.15.1515;}\viewkind4\uc1\pard\ltrpar\cf1\b\f0\fs20 When the translation files are set up, text onscreen is automatically translated by Magic.\par \par \cf2 SetLang()\cf1 is the function that is used to change the chosen language at runtime. In this example, you can choose a language and then press Set Language. \par \par \cf2 GetLang()\cf1 is used to query the current language. In this example, it is used to display the current language.\par \par The \cf2 Set Language \cf1 button will change the current language, then display a window showing some translated text.\par \par Only certain parts of the window are automatically translated. To force translation of other text, you can use the\cf2 MLSTrans()\cf1 function.\par \par Refer to program EV13a for information on how to create the translation files.\par }

{\rtf1\fbidis\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset0 Microsoft Sans Serif;}} {\colortbl ;\red0\green0\blue0;\red255\green0\blue128;} {\*\generator Msftedit 5.41.15.1515;}\viewkind4\uc1\pard\ltrpar\cf1\b\f0\fs20 Here you can see the translated text. If the text does not have a translation, it will be displayed in the default language.\par \par Static texts are translated automatically.\par \par \cf2 MLSTrans()\cf1 will translate any text. Here it is used with the radio and list box controls.\par \par The color values are not translated automatically since they are real data from the database.\par \par \par }

Text.val: Set the language using SetLang(). If Default is chosen, then SetLang()

Text.valUnicode: {\rtf1\fbidis\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset0 Microsoft Sans Serif;}} {\colortbl ;\red0\green0\blue0;\red255\green0\blue128;} {\*\generator Msftedit 5.41.15.1515;}\viewkind4\uc1\pard\ltrpar\cf1\b\f0\fs20 When the translation files are set up, text onscreen is automatically translated by Magic.\par \par \cf2 SetLang()\cf1 is the function that is used to change the chosen language at runtime. In this example, you can choose a language and then press Set Language. \par \par \cf2 GetLang()\cf1 is used to query the current language. In this example, it is used to display the current language.\par \par The \cf2 Set Language \cf1 button will change the current language, then display a window showing some translated text.\par \par Only certain parts of the window are automatically translated. To force translation of other text, you can use the\cf2 MLSTrans()\cf1 function.\par \par Refer to program EV13a for information on how to create the translation files.\par }

{\rtf1\fbidis\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset0 Microsoft Sans Serif;}} {\colortbl ;\red0\green0\blue0;\red255\green0\blue128;} {\*\generator Msftedit 5.41.15.1515;}\viewkind4\uc1\pard\ltrpar\cf1\b\f0\fs20 Here you can see the translated text. If the text does not have a translation, it will be displayed in the default language.\par \par Static texts are translated automatically.\par \par \cf2 MLSTrans()\cf1 will translate any text. Here it is used with the radio and list box controls.\par \par The color values are not translated automatically since they are real data from the database.\par \par \par }
